arts.ttl: Thiago Motta on draw with Empoli: ‘It’s not the result we wanted but we are on the right track’
arts.sum: Juventus faced a frustrating evening as they were held to a 0-0 draw by Empoli in their Serie A encounter at the Carlo Castellani stadium. The result left manager Thiago Motta with mixed feelings about his team’s performance. Motta acknowledged the team’s defensive solidity but emphasized the need for improvement in attack. “We didn’t concede, which is the responsibility of the entire team. In the second half, we improved by utilizing our wide players and pushing Empoli back,” he explained. Despite the clean sheet, the Juventus coach was not entirely satisfied with the outcome. “We’re returning home with a point, The post Thiago Motta on draw with Empoli: ‘It’s not the result we wanted but we are on the right track’ appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Thiago Motta: ‘Perin and Nico Gonzalez deserved to play’
arts.sum: Juventus manager Thiago Motta spoke to DAZN before his team’s match against Empoli, their first game after the international break. Motta provided insight into his lineup choices and tactical approach for the upcoming fixture. When asked about what kind of Juventus performance to expect, Motta emphasized the importance of minimizing errors: “Today we want to make few mistakes because Empoli transitions very quickly and puts pressure on the defensive phase.” Regarding his decision to start Mattia Perin in goal, Motta explained: “Perin also deserves to play for the work he’s been doing.
